author: Rose Troup Buchanan
title: People Are Sharing #DisabledAndCute Photos And It's Beautifully Empowering - BuzzFeed News
text:
View this image ‚Ä∫
Keah Brown / Via Twitter: @Keah_Maria ID: 10541714 3. And people loved it. Hundreds of people shared great pics of themselves. #DisabledandCute y'all already know ‚ú®üíïüòõ
‚Äî desteny (@floraldes) ID: 10541674 sick girl glam #disabledandcute
‚Äî Esm√© Weijun Wang (@esmewang) ID: 10541793 I was diagnosed with trigeminal neuralgia and obsessive compulsive disorder Summer 2016. I am #DisabledAndCute!‚Ä¶ https://t.co/IRzqIbOE7A
‚Äî Ashley Loftin (@OCDwrangler) ID: 10541801 i have a spinal cord lession at T10 which means i don't move or feel my legs, or can walk but hey!!! im still happy‚Ä¶ https://t.co/dhC6fD3eBD
‚Äî „Ö§ (@IittletroubIe) ID: 10541860 7. Some expressed how difficult it can be showing they were more than the disability that people define them by. "the worst thing about a disability is that people see it before they see you." #DisabledAndCute #CerebralPalsy
‚Äî Lilly (@lfrank331) ID: 10541769 #DisabledAndCute Chronic Lyme Disease, Severe Chronic Pain and Limited Mobility can't stop me from looking cute.
‚Äî Shaelene Robar (@aGirlWithLyme) ID: 10541828 #disabledandcute ‚ôøÔ∏èüòèüíØ
‚Äî BasedOnAWheelStory‚ôøÔ∏è (@OsamaBinRollin) ID: 10541876 Here's my fierce take on #DisabledAndCute
‚Äî alice wong (@SFdirewolf) ID: 10541964 11. While lots of those with disabilities were visible, others also shared their invisible disabilities. sickle cell ain't never kept ya girl down #invisiblediseases #disabledandcute
‚Äî Laelah (@laelahndifon) ID: 10541779 12. And there were lots of people celebrating Brown, for kicking the whole hashtag off in the first place! My #disabledandcute friend üòç #SheisTAKEN! https://t.co/MV5tWWKdwc
‚Äî Elizabeth (@IB_Elizabeth98) ID: 10541878 Check out the tag #DisabledandCute created by @Keah_Maria, We're out here, we're not a monolith, disability is attractive.
‚Äî Andr√© J. Daughtry ‚ôø‚ôí (@Tripping_Crutch) ID: 10541926 #disabledandcute thank you @Keah_Maria for creating such an explosively simple, yet totally necessary hashtag. <3
‚Äî Andrew Gurza (@andrewgurza) ID: 10541791 15. Brown added she ‚Äúnever thought‚Äù so many people would join in. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt go in thinking ‚ÄòThis will be viral!‚Äô Or that it‚Äôs not going to fade away in a few hours let alone a few days,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty cool.‚Äù View this image ‚Ä∫
Keah Brown / Via Twitter: @Keah_Maria ID: 10542253 16. The use of ‚Äúcute‚Äù outside the disabled community can be problematic, Brown also explained, as there had been a small number of negative comments. We are often belittled & made to feel small. I just wanted everyone to celebrate themselves. I'm not trying to force anyone to do anything.
‚Äî Keah Brown (@Keah_Maria) ID: 10541967 17. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a loaded word in the disability community because it can be very belittling when able bodied people call us cute. However, I think there‚Äôs power in taking back the word for myself.‚Äù #DisabledandCute you are all so beautiful but most importantly, you are worthy of this feeling. Hold on to it, keep it for your bad days. <3
‚Äî Keah Brown (@Keah_Maria) ID: 10541980 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
Rose Troup Buchanan is a reporter for BuzzFeed News and is based in London. Contact Rose Troup Buchanan at Rose.Buchanan@BuzzFeed.com . Got a confidential tip? Submit it here .
